criteria: Clarity and Organization of the Model
Application of Scientific Practices and Crosscutting Concepts
descriptions: Model is missing or completely inaccurate, showing no understanding of nuclear composition changes.
Model contains significant inaccuracies in representing the composition of the nucleus during nuclear processes.
Model demonstrates some understanding of nuclear composition but contains several inaccuracies or omissions.
Model accurately represents the main changes in nuclear composition during fission, fusion, or radioactive decay but may lack detail.
Model is mostly accurate and detailed, illustrating the changes in nuclear composition during nuclear processes with only minor errors.
Model is highly accurate, detailed, and clearly illustrates the changes in nuclear composition during fission, fusion, and radioactive decay, demonstrating a strong understanding.
Model does not address energy release or incorrectly represents it.
Model mentions energy release but provides no context or inaccurate information.
Model includes some information about energy release, but the explanation is vague or partially incorrect.
Model adequately represents energy release during nuclear processes, showing a basic understanding of the concept.
Model clearly represents energy release and provides a good qualitative comparison to other types of transformations.
Model accurately and comprehensively represents energy release, providing a clear qualitative comparison to other transformations and demonstrating a deep understanding.
Model is disorganized and unclear, making it difficult to understand the represented processes.
Model is somewhat disorganized and lacks clarity in representing the nuclear processes.
Model is understandable but could benefit from improved organization and clearer labels.
Model is organized and mostly clear, effectively communicating the nuclear processes being illustrated.
Model is well-organized, clear, and easy to understand, enhancing the communication of nuclear processes.
Model is exceptionally well-organized, clear, and visually appealing, providing an insightful representation of nuclear processes.
Model fails to apply relevant scientific practices or crosscutting concepts.
Model attempts to apply scientific practices or crosscutting concepts but does so incorrectly or superficially.
Model applies some scientific practices or crosscutting concepts, but the connection is weak or not fully explained.
Model demonstrates a reasonable application of scientific practices (Developing and Using Models) and crosscutting concepts (Energy and Matter).
Model effectively applies scientific practices and crosscutting concepts to enhance the understanding of nuclear processes.
Model expertly applies scientific practices and crosscutting concepts, providing a sophisticated understanding of nuclear processes and their broader implications.
